title: Is there any way to find out where this picture was taken? Or what that B means? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hard to tell. The single letter marking in that spot appears to have been somewhat common. Here’s an example with a “C”:  This is, according to Wikimedia Commons, a Flak battery in firing position somewhere in Germany in 1943… I’ve found other pictures of 8,8cm Flak guns – which is my best shot at guessing what type of gun “yours” is – marked that way with differing letters. My guess is that it might be a way to denote the individual guns in a battery… For placing this, the guy with the white tunic could be a hint. My first thought was he might be navy – but apparently, white tunics as part of the summer uniform were issued to pretty much all  parts of the Wehrmacht and SS at different times.  So, we can say this was most likely taken in the summertime. Wearing the summer tunic with open collar and tie was apparently only allowed relatively late in the war – likely around ’43, so this would be later than that. The presence of the white summer tunic pretty much rules out Africa – the Afrikacorps had their own, somewhat distinctive uniforms. The landscape looks a lot more like Europe, as well. My guess from what little scenery can be seen would be either Northern or central Germany, Northern France, the Netherlands or somewhere in the plains of (North)Eastern Europe in the summer of ’43 or ’44…

The 8.8cm FlaK gun was used all over the german reich in the WWII, it was very important against the english tanks in africa. That B is just random. What can you recognise in the picture, what is important? From where are these troops?What gun is that?  The troops are from the German airforce, which also handled the anti aircraft warfareThe gun is a german 8.8cm FlaK gun, in the desert camouflage

B might be B section of the flak battery. The men here are Luftwaffe, but the white tunic looks a little odd. Too short, the other white uniforms were standard length. Almost looks like a mess waiter's uniform except they came to a point in front???? Perhaps some one can answer this question.
Um, well if you told me what "this" is, sure. Then, nope.B probably means its the second of the lace,  person got a decent grade, the person's middle name starts with or is B etc.
B is the second letter in Roman alphabet. But, I'm sure you are talking about something completely different.
